Detailed Description

The UusHandler is a SS handler responsible for modifying the UUS supplementary service. This includes activating and interrogating the service. Currently only UUS1 implicit is supported. The handler provides various methods for these purposes.

Member Function Documentation

SsApiRc UusHandler::Erase (  SsCode  ss_code,
UusOutTextType  type
) 
 

Erases a text for UUS
Erases a text currently set for a UUS. If erasing was successful a SsRequestSentMsg is sent beside the return result of this method. Otherwise a SsRequestRejectedMsg is sent containing the error code returned by this method.

Note:
Currently only UUS1 implicit is supported. Unlike for other Supplementary Services, erasing UUS does not involve communication with the network, so no Supplementary Service strings are generated or sent.
Parameters:
ss_code Has to be UusService1.
type Type of UUS text that shall be erased
Returns:
Success, if text has been stored successfully ServiceNotSupported, if ss_code was UusService2 or UusService3 InvalidServiceCode, if ss_code was anything other than UUS

SsApiRc UusHandler::Register (  SsCode  ss_code,
const WString &  uus_text,
UusOutTextType  type
) 
 

Registers a text for UUS
Registers a text for UUS. The text is sent to the other party during a call at the stage of the call defined by the text type. If the registration was successful a SsRequestSentMsg is sent beside the return result of this method. Otherwise a SsRequestRejectedMsg is sent containing the error code returned by this method.

Note:
Currently only UUS1 implicit is supported. Unlike for other Supplementary Services, registering UUS does not involve communication with the network, so no Supplementary Service strings are generated or sent. The given text is hold only in RAM until the next reboot, hence any application that want's UUS texts to be sent has to re-register the texts at startup.
Parameters:
ss_code Has to be UusService1.
uus_text Text to send during call.
type Type of UUS text
Returns:
Success, if text has been stored successfully ServiceNotSupported, if ss_code was UusService2 or UusService3 InvalidServiceCode, if ss_code was anything other than UUS

SsApiRc UusHandler::RequestStatus (  SsCode  ss_code  ) 
 

Interrogates the UUS status.
Queries, which texts are currently active for the given UUS. The result of the query is sent with an UusStatusMsg.

If the query was successful a SsRequestSentMsg is sent beside the return result of this method. Otherwise a SsRequestRejectedMsg is sent containing the error code returned by this method.

Parameters:
ss_code Has to be UusService1.
Returns:
Success, if text has been stored successfully ServiceNotSupported, if ss_code was UusService2 or UusService3 InvalidServiceCode, if ss_code was anything other than UUS
